ai.summary: A 10.3 km circular coastal walk starting and finishing in Hunstanton, Norfolk (UK). This moderate route threads along cliff-top paths, open shoreline, and grassy trails, offering sea views, estuary wetlands, and a mix of seaside scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly coastal footpaths with sections of chalk/flint surface, grassy field edges, and occasional wooden boardwalks. Some beach stretches may be sandy or uneven; expect exposed sections along clifftops and variable surfaces.
ai.safety_notes: Coastal weather can change quickly. Stay well back from cliff edges, especially after rainfall. Wear sturdy footwear and bring waterproofs. Check tide times before beach sections. Carry water, sun protection, a map or device, and a small first-aid kit. Keep dogs under control where required. Be prepared for wind on open sections.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October) offer milder weather and clearer coastal views; winter walks are possible but can be windy and with shorter daylight.

seo.title: Hunstanton Circular Walk — 10.3 km Coastal Hike in Norfolk, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Hunstanton Circular, a 10.3 km moderate coastal hike in Norfolk, UK. Explore cliff-top paths, beaches, and wetlands with practical safety tips and gear recommendations.
